test_cue_subscriber.cpp
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 /*
2  test_cue_subscriber.cpp
3  Test module to subscribe to the output of a cue-detection node
4  (v = [theta, magnitude]). This module will attempt to maintain
5  a goal angle by interacting with the locomotion package.
6 */
7 
8 #include <ros/ros.h>
9 #include "std_msgs/String.h"
10 
11 #include "bb_computation/icm.h"
12 #include "bb_computation/cue_vector.h"
13 
14 #include "bb_util/velocity.h"
15 
16 #define GOAL_ANGLE -2.0
17 #define TRAVERSE_TIME 30
18 
19 ros::ServiceClient client;
20 
21 // Init CX
22 //CentralComplex cx;
23 
24 void cvCallback(const bb_computation::cue_vector::ConstPtr& cue_msg){
25  ROS_INFO("Cue info: (R: %f, T: %f)",
26  cue_msg->magnitude,
27  cue_msg->theta);
28 
29  float current = cue_msg->theta;
30  float error = GOAL_ANGLE - current;
31  float correction_velocity = -0.09*error;
32 
33  bb_util::velocity msg;
34 
35  msg.request.angular = correction_velocity;
36 
37  msg.request.linear = 0.0;
38  client.call(msg);
39 }
40 
41 int main(int argc, char **argv){
42  ros::init(argc, argv, "test_cue_subscriber");
43  ros::NodeHandle n;
44 
45  ros::Subscriber sub = n.subscribe("visual_cue", 1000, cvCallback);
46  client = n.serviceClient<bb_util::velocity>("update_velocity");
47 
48  ROS_INFO("Running...");
49 
50  ros::spin();
51  return 0;
52 }
